ဘဂ္ဂဝဂေါတ္တ（တိ）
[bhaggava+gotta]
[ဘဂ္ဂဝ+ဂေါတ္တ]

Bhaggavagotta：A clothed Wanderer （channaparibbājaka） （DA．iii．816），who lived in a pleasance near Anupiyā．

He was a friend of Sunakkhatta （q．v．）．

The Buddha once visited him，and their conversation is recorded in thePātika Sutta （q．v．） （D．iii．1ff）．

He was evidently so called because he belonged to the gotta namedBhaggava （？ potters）．
